required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic and Phenotypic Characteristics of Mitral Valve Prolapse
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic and Phenotypic Characteristics of Mitral Valve Prolapse

brief_summary.textblock: Phenotypic characterisation of MVP by echocardiography in families. Identification of genes involved in MVP.

detailed_description.textblock: After clinical identification of patients with MVP, doctors organize 1st degree relative familial screening. A comprehensive echocardiography was carried out along with clinical examination. All echo data were stored for off-line analysis by a sonographer in our Core-lab. Blood was sample at the time of echocardiography in adult patients for DNA analyses. Follow-up for mitral valve changes will be performed after 5 years.

primary_outcome.measure: MVP defined by a superior displacement of at least 2 mm
primary_outcome.description: MVP defined by a superior displacement of at least 2 mm

secondary_outcome.measure: Comprehensive mitral valve apparatus characterization per size of items (leaflets, chordae, annulus)
secondary_outcome.description: Leaflets length ; Chordae length ; Annulus diameter

secondary_outcome.measure: Comprehensive mitral valve apparatus characterization per other items (papillary muscle, ventricles)
secondary_outcome.description: Papillary muscles aspect ; Right Ventricle function ; Left Ventricle Ejection Fraction

secondary_outcome.measure: Comprehensive mitral valve apparatus characterization per size of items (ventricle and atrium sizes)
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricle and atrium sizes ; right ventricle size ; right Atrium size

secondary_outcome.measure: Comprehensive mitral valve apparatus characterization per size of items

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of cardiac or clinical defects associated with MVP
other_outcome.time_frame: At Day 0 Follow-up will be carried out at 5 and 10 years
other_outcome.description: Atrial septal defect, ventricular septal defect, patent ductus arteriosus, tricuspid or aortic valve abnormalities (prolapse, bicuspid AV…), coarctation, ascending aorta aneurysm

arm_group.description: The patients concerned are patients with known or recently discovered Barlow-type mitral prolapse, whatever the degree of severity.
Related healthy patients, for an average of 6 individuals per family

study_pop.textblock: Patients of both sex of any age with typical mitral valve prolapse and relatives examined during familial screening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients of any age
- with typical mitral valve prolapse
- relatives examined during familial screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of the patient

overall_official.affiliation: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France
